extends java.lang.Object

      • getInstance

        public static FingerprintManager getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        Get single instance of FingerprintManager class.

        context - the context for the receiver and USB accesses

      • getDeviceList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getDeviceList()
        Get a list of connected devices.
        Returns:
        A list of device.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws FingerprintException
        Initialize the fingerprint reader in running environment, normally call this API in application process, and only need to call once before releasing the device.
        Throws:
        FingerprintException

      • release

        public void release()
        Release the resources applied by initialize.

      • setDeviceListener

        public void setDeviceListener(FingerDeviceListener paramDeviceListener)
        Set up a listener for plugging and unplugging device. When a device is plugged in, the parameter DeviceListener will receive FingerDeviceListener.deviceAttached(List) invoked with a new list of device, When a device is unplugged, the parameter DeviceListener will receive FingerDeviceListener.deviceDetached(List)() invoked with a new list of device.
        Parameters:
        paramDeviceListener - Call back function (See Interface FingerDeviceListener)

      • getDeviceCount

        public int getDeviceCount()
                   throws FingerprintException
        Counts the number of connected fingerprint readers. Only the attached devices to which the caller has been granted permission will be counted.
        Returns:
        Number of fingerprint readers counted.
        Throws:
        FingerprintException

      • openDevice

        public void openDevice(int index,
              FingerDeviceOpenListener deviceOpenListener)
                throws FingerprintException
        Initialize device asynchronously, given a particular device index. This function returns immediately, and does not wait whether the APK has access permission or not. If the APK does not have access permission, it will request for one, but it terminates immediately after the request. The parameter deviceOpenListener will receive openSuccess() invoked with a device object. When an error occurs, openFail()will be invoked with the error message that occurred.
        Parameters:
        index - zero-based index of the device
        deviceOpenListener - Call back function once opened the device (See Interface FingerDeviceOpenListener)
        Throws:
        FingerprintException

      • getLibraryVersion

        public java.lang.String getLibraryVersion()
        Obtains the fingerprint library version .
        Returns:
        fingerprint library Version.
